intro: Conradia craniolaria, commonly known as the skullcap plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and showy blue to purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Conradia craniolaria is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally by Indigenous peoples for various health purposes.
